[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/state.rs] [Struct: RawStateValueRequest] [Database transaction] Are state reads within a proper database transaction boundary, or can concurrent writes cause torn reads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/state.rs] [Struct: RawStateValueRequest] [Experimental stability] As an experimental API, are there incomplete validations or security checks that would be present in stable endpoints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/state.rs] [Struct: RawStateValueRequest] [TableHandle enumeration] Can an attacker brute-force TableHandle values in StateKey::TableItem to discover all active tables in the blockchain? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/state.rs] [Struct: RawStateValueRequest] [Table key extraction] Can crafted keys extract table items without knowing the proper key type, bypassing Move type safety for table access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/state.rs] [Struct: RawStateValueRequest] [Cross-table access] Can manipulating the TableHandle allow reading from tables the requester shouldn't have access to, like governance voting records? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/state.rs] [Struct: RawStateValueRequest] [Resource extraction] Can StateKey::AccessPath with Path::Resource be crafted to read any resource type at any address, bypassing Move visibility rules? (Critical)
